thread.title: What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015?
thread.title_full: What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015?

title: What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015?
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015? Back To The Future II didn't get it all right, but it did get some surprising ones correct. Post to Facebook What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015? Back To The Future II didn't get it all right, but it did get some surprising ones correct. Check out this story on 9news.com: http://on9news.tv/1RVqBYQ Cancel Send A link has been sent to your friend's email address. Posted! A link has been posted to your Facebook feed. Join the Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs What did Back To The Future II get right, wrong for 2015? Blair Shiff, USA Today and Steve Staeger, KUSA 2:03 a.m. MDT October 21, 2015 Miniature toys are displayed during a celebration event of the 30th anniversary of the movie 'Back to the Future' in Sao Paulo, Brazil on October 17, 2015. (Photo: Miguel Schincariol/AFP/Getty Images) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
KUSA - The second installment of the Back To The Future trilogy finds Marty McFly, portrayed by Michael J. Fox, time-traveling to Oct. 21, 2015.Among his discoveries are hand-held computers, video chatting, Major League Baseball in Miami, and a preponderance of cameras. 
But what is life really like 30 years after the movie? 
On New Year's Day in 2015, 9NEWS Reporter Steve Staeger investigated this. He found: http://on9news.tv/1W3RBuW. 
In the movie, characters communicate over video inside their home. It was technology that wasn't easily available in 1985 but is now readily available through apps like Skype, FaceTime or even Facebook. 
Future Marty McFly's children answer the phone with their glasses, much like some users can now using Google Glass. 
The McFlys enter their home using a biometric scanner, much like modern day technology which uses thumbprints to unlock the iPhone. 
And even though the outcome has yet to be determined, the Chicago Cubs are in the running for NLCS. Though the Mets are up on the series currently. In the movie, the Cubbies had won the World Series. Michael J. Fox, left, as Marty McFly and Christopher Lloyd as Dr. Emmett Brown in a scene from Back to the Future. Universal Pictures, AP Fullscreen After Back to the Future, Michael J. Fox starred in the films Doc Hollywoodand The Frighteners. He also starred in the television show Spin Cityfor four seasons. The show even featured a guest appearance from his Back to the Future co-star, Christopher Lloyd. Eric Liebowitz, ABC Most recently, Fox starred in the The Michael J. Fox Show, which ran for one season. Eric Liebowitz, NBC Christopher Lloyd, who played Dr. Emmett Brown, went on to play Uncle Fester in the movie adaptation of The Addams Family and Uncle Martin in My Favorite Martian. Today, Lloyd continues to act in television, movies and theater productions. Michael Monday, for USA TODAY Lea Thompson, who played Lorraine Baines McFly, is most notable for her starring role in NBC's Caroline in the City. Paul Drinkwater, NBC Most recently, Thompson appeared season 19 of Dancing With the Stars. Here she's seen performing at the 23rd annual A Night at Sardi's to benefit the Alzheimer's Association at the Beverly Hilton Hotel. Jordan Strauss, Invision for Alzheimer's Association Crispin Glover, who played George McFly in Back to the Future, but did not reprise his role in the sequels, continues to act in both movies and on television. Most notably, Glover appeared as Thin Man in the Charlie's Angelsseries. Larry Busacca, Getty Images Fullscreen Thomas F. Wilson, who played Biff Tannen, played Coach Ben Fredricks in the beloved, but short-lived, television show Freaks and Geeks. You also can hear Wilson's voice as a variety of characters on SpongeBob SquarePants. Beyond acting, Wilson also is a painter and a stand-up comedian. NBC Fullscreen Claudia Wells, who played Jennifer Parker in the original Back to the Future, but did not reprise her role in the sequels due to personal reason, continues to act independent films. Additionally, Wells run a high-end men's clothing resale shop in Studio City, Calif. Imeh Akpanudosen, Getty Images for Lisa Haisha Fullscreen Elisabeth Shue played Jennifer Parker in Back to the Future Part II and Back to the Future Part III. Shue was nominated for an Academy Award for her role as Sera in Leaving Las Vegas. Most recently, she played Julie Finlay on CSI: Crime Scene Investigation. Alberto E. Rodriguez, Getty Images Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay
